title._content: Last days of the Old Library in the Old Building, 1978

description._content: Left to right: Janet Richardson, Frederick Blackburn. Taken by Diana Sanders. Frederick Blackburn started as a junior in the library and became Conservation Officer. In 1963 when the School decided to have its own bindery in the library Frederick Blackburn was responsible for setting it up. He met his wife at LSE - Eileen Geraghty from the Library periodicals department. He retired in 1984, but continued part-time conservation work. (Information from LSE Magazine, November 1984, no 68, p.23) IMAGELIBRARY/555 Persistent URL: archives.lse.ac.uk/dserve.exe?dsqServer=lib-4.lse.ac.uk&a...
